documentation.text:
@notice Check if the channel is not present.
 @param channelId Identifier of the channel.

@notice Check if the channel is present: in open or settling state.
 @param channelId Identifier of the channel.

@notice Check if the channel is open: present and not settling.
 @param channelId Identifier of the channel.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureLength(uint256).details: The signature has an invalid length.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureS(bytes32).details: The signature has an S value that is in the upper half order.

canClaim(bytes32,uint256,address,bytes).details: Check if `signature` is made by sender part of the channel, and is for payment promise (see `paymentDigest`).

canSettle(bytes32).details: Check if settling period is over by comparing `settlingUntil` to a current block number.

claim(bytes32,uint256,bytes).details: Can be claimed by channel receiver only. Guarded by `canClaim`.

isSettling(bytes32).details: It is settling, if `settlingUntil` is set to non-zero.

open(bytes32,address,uint256,address,uin.details: Before opening a channel, the sender should `approve` spending the token by TokenUnidirectional contract.

params.channelId: Unique identifier of the channel to be created.
params.receiver: Receiver of the funds, counter-party of `msg.sender`.
params.settlingPeriod: Number of blocks to wait for receiver to `claim` her funds after the sender starts settling period (see `startSettling`). After that period is over anyone could call `settle`, and move all the channel funds to the sender.

params.payment: Amount to send, and to claim later.

returns._0: Hash of the payment promise to sign.

startSettling(bytes32).details: Actually set `settlingUntil` field of the PaymentChannel structure.

devdoc.title: Unidirectional payment channels contract for ERC20 tokens.

canClaim(bytes32,uint256,address,bytes).notice: Ensure `origin` address can claim `payment` amount on channel identified by `channelId`.

canDeposit(bytes32,address).notice: Ensure `origin` address can deposit funds into the channel identified by `channelId`.

canSettle(bytes32).notice: Ensure one can settle the channel identified by `channelId`.

canStartSettling(bytes32,address).notice: Ensure `origin` address can start settling the channel identified by `channelId`.

claim(bytes32,uint256,bytes).notice: Claim the funds, and close the channel.

deposit(bytes32,uint256).notice: Add more funds to the contract.

isAbsent(bytes32).notice: Check if the channel is not present.

isOpen(bytes32).notice: Check if the channel is open: present and not settling.

isPresent(bytes32).notice: Check if the channel is present: in open or settling state.

isSettling(bytes32).notice: Check if the channel is in settling state: waits till the settling period is over.

open(bytes32,address,uint256,address,uin.notice: Open a new channel between `msg.sender` and `receiver`, and do an initial deposit to the channel.

settle(bytes32).notice: Move the money to sender, and close the channel. After the settling period is over, and receiver has not claimed the funds, anyone could call that.

startSettling(bytes32).notice: Sender initiates settling of the contract.
